Class Translator

  • java.lang.Object
    • Translator

  • public class Translator
extends java.lang.Object
    this class handles translations and provides wrapper methods to handle the Dictionary class.
    Author:
    group 1

    • Method Detail

      • translateFile

        public double translateFile(java.lang.String filename,
                            java.lang.String translationFilename,
                            java.lang.String direction)
                     throws DirectionException,
                            java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Opens file, translates and outputs to another file
        Parameters:
        filename - name of file to translate
        translationFilename - name of file to output translation
        direction - the direction to translate the file
        Returns:
        words translated per second
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - thrown if the file couldn't be found
        DirectionException - thrown if there is a problem with the direction. the getMessage() to get more information about the problem

      • loadDictionary

        public void loadDictionary(java.lang.String direction)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           java.lang.Exception
        loads a dictionary from a file. If the file doesn't exists, a new file will be created.
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction of the dictionary in the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exceptions passed from the Dictionary class
        java.lang.Exception

      • saveDictionaryToFile

        public void saveDictionaryToFile()
        Saves all dictionaries to a files

      • translate

        public java.lang.String translate(java.lang.String input,
                                  java.lang.String direction)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        translates a string from one language into an other. For example, translate("dog", "en", "de") would return "Hund".
        Parameters:
        input - the text to be translated
        direction - direction
        Returns:
        the translated text
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - unable to translate (probably wrong direction)

      • removeFromDictionary

        public void removeFromDictionary(java.lang.String text,
                                 java.lang.String direction)
        removes a word or a sentence from the dictionary
        Parameters:
        text - the word or sentence to be removed.
        direction - the dictionary the word should be removed from.

      • displayDictionary

        public java.lang.String displayDictionary(java.lang.String direction)
        returns a whole dictionary as a String
        Parameters:
        direction - the dictionary to display
        Returns:
        a dictionary as a String

        public java.lang.String detectLanguage(java.lang.String text)
        detects a language of a given String
        Parameters:
        text - the String to detect the language from
        Returns:
        the language of the String
